dialogue_history.content:
Analyze this financial news and estimate stock price movement probabilities.
Company: Apple Inc. (AAPL)
News Headline: Streaming turned profits in 2024. Wall Street's biggest worry is whether momentum can last.
News Content: For years, the world's biggest media companies struggled to make money off of their streaming services. The culprits: pricey content, user churn, and lots of competition.

In 2024, that finally changed.

The five giants — Netflix (NFLX), Disney (DIS), Paramount (PARA), NBCUniversal's Peacock (CMCSA), and Warner Bros. Discovery's Max (WBD) — collectively reported a profit in the first nine months of the year for the very first time. In total, those five companies delivered earnings of roughly $5.9 billion, significantly ahead of the $142 million loss the group reported in the year-ago period.

Netflix led the charge, pulling in roughly $6.9 billion in earnings in the first three quarters. (Wall Street declared the company the unofficial winner of the streaming wars.) But there's more: Earlier this week the company reported an additional $1.87 billion in profits to end the fourth quarter — and nearly 20 million more subscribers.

The other four media giants will report fourth quarter results later this month and next, with Comcast first up on Jan. 30. A big question for investors is whether or not traditional players can successfully follow the leader.

Last year delivered some early answers. Disney and Paramount Global each reported their first quarter of streaming profits in August. Also, Peacock significantly narrowed year-over-year losses, while WBD's streaming profits ended the year on positive footing.

Macquarie analyst Tim Nollen categorized the improvements as "progress," but cautioned that even the streamers who have hit profitability don't have enough profits to generate significant margins. Most, with the obvious exception of Netflix, have hit just around breakeven.

For Morningstar analyst Matthew Dolgin, the key to success is "the pace of revenue growth." He added, "To me, profits are a lot about scale. ... So if you can increase scale, which we saw some benefits from this past year, then you can maintain profitability."

For traditional media companies, he continued, being profitable isn't enough. "Because they have terrible linear businesses that continue to decline, they need streaming to be more than just profitable. They need streaming to produce fast-growing profits."

What lies ahead

The "streaming wars," which unofficially kicked off in November 2019 following the launch of Disney's flagship streaming platform, set off an accelerated race for content, talent, and subscribers. That led to an era of overspending as platforms, both new and established, raced to lure top producers and secure the most sought-after shows.

Story Continues

But investors quickly realized that it's difficult to monetize users, justify the high cost of content, keep subscribers engaged, and turn a profit. One of the biggest reasons: streaming's low price point. With the exception of cable replacement services like YouTube TV and Hulu + Live TV, prices can range anywhere from $4.99 a month to $22.99.

That low cost means more subscribers are needed to generate significant returns. Lourdes Balduque via Getty Images

In response to investors' growing profit fears, companies adjusted their strategies and were eventually able to attract more subscribers through controversial password-sharing crackdowns and multi-tier subscription offerings, in addition to more strategic content acquisitions and the return of key original programming.

Companies also shifted how aggressively they spend their money. Instead of ballooning content budgets and releasing as many shows as possible, streamers pulled back to focus on more quality over quantity projects.

"Everything was kind of messy for a few years," Macquarie's Nollen said. "Streamers are finally getting the revenue and cost lines to balance out. But it's questionable how profitable these services can be."

(edited)

One obstacle to achieving consistent profits is combating increased churn in the face of higher prices. (Netflix became the latest platform to boost subscription costs in the US, bumping the prices of its various tiers earlier this week.)

"The bigger risk is really retaining the customer base and figuring out whether we get to a threshold where there are too many platforms," Morningstar's Dolgin said. Also, "there's a limit" to how much more streamers can raise prices. Simultaneously, there's a limit to how many more subscribers streamers can add.

"Somewhere, you need to get that right in order to keep profits growing at a good pace," he said.

To combat fickle subscribers, competing platforms are now bundling their services together. As WBD CEO David Zaslav told investors last year, "There's more strength together."

"I have a difficult time envisioning a scenario where any one of these players takes Netflix's mantle," Dolgin said. "So [bundling with one another] is how they close the gap. They don't do it individually. They could potentially do it as a collective."

And if recent news of mass layoffs and restructurings are any indication (Case in point: CNN's digital revamp), the road to catching up to Netflix — and just basic survival in the streaming-first era — might be a bumpy one.

•USD

(NFLX)

Follow  View Quote Details

Alexandra Canal is a Senior Reporter at Yahoo Finance. Follow her on X @allie_canal, LinkedIn, and email her at alexandra.canal@yahoofinance.com.

Next I will provide you some predictions of stock price movement probabilities and the corresponding analysis by others in the previous rounds.
Note that others' predictions may indicate that they have some other information about the stock price. A high prediction may indicate that they have some positive information about the stock, while a low prediction may indicate that they have some megative information about the stock.
Also note that there are multiple rounds of precitions, demonstrating the trend of others' beliefs.
Please take these information into consideration when prediction the stock price movement probabilities.
Previous predictions:
Round: 0
Model: openai/gpt-4o-mini, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.65, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.35, Reasoning: The news indicates a positive trend in profitability for streaming services, particularly highlighting Netflix's significant earnings boost. This improvement could be seen positively by investors, as it reflects a shift toward sustainable profitability in the streaming sector. However, the cautious outlook from analysts regarding continued profitability and the risks associated with customer retention and increased competition could temper enthusiasm for broader media stocks. For Apple, which is not directly involved in the streaming wars but does benefit from overall consumer spending and media consumption trends, the news is somewhat supportive but not conclusive. Therefore, the probabilities for stock price movement are cautiously optimistic for a rise, but with certain risks present. Thus, I estimate a higher probability for a rise in price than a fall, but not overwhelmingly so.
Model: google/gemini-2.0-flash-001, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.55, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.45, Reasoning: The news focuses on the broader streaming landscape and its positive trend toward profitability in 2024. While it doesn't directly mention Apple's streaming service (Apple TV+), the overall positive sentiment in the industry is likely to have a slightly positive impact on Apple's stock. The article highlights Netflix's success and explores challenges faced by traditional media companies in achieving consistent and significant streaming profits. Therefore, Apple may be indirectly affected by overall trends in the industry, but it is not a main focus considering this analysis. The news does not give a strong directional impetus for Apple's stock, considering, if any, Apple's streaming profits are likely to be small as compared to other ventures by Apple. Therefore, the probability for its stock rising is only slightly higher.
Model: google/gemini-flash-1.5, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.3, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.2, Reasoning: The news focuses on the profitability of streaming services in 2024, highlighting the collective success of major players like Netflix, Disney, and others. While this is generally positive, the article also emphasizes significant challenges.  These include maintaining profitability (margins are still low for most except Netflix), combating subscriber churn in the face of price increases, and the competitive landscape.  The uncertainty around the sustainability of this newfound profitability and the potential limitations of growth (both subscriber base and price increases) create a cautious outlook. While the positive news of streaming profits could initially boost Apple's stock (as Apple TV+ is part of their services segment), the overall cautious tone regarding the future of streaming profitability and the article's focus on other companies limits the extent of any positive impact on AAPL. The news is not directly about Apple's performance, making a strong prediction difficult.  Therefore, a slight probability of price increase is assumed, balanced by a higher probability of sideways movement or slight decline due to the overall cautious outlook for the streaming industry, which is a small segment of Apple's business.
Model: deepseek/deepseek-chat-v3-0324, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.6, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.4, Reasoning: The news highlights a significant turnaround in the profitability of streaming services for major media companies, including Apple Inc. (AAPL), which has its own streaming service, Apple TV+. The collective profitability of the streaming industry in 2024, after years of losses, is a positive development. However, concerns about sustaining this momentum, potential price increases leading to higher churn rates, and the need for continued scale to maintain profitability introduce uncertainty. Apple's strong ecosystem and brand loyalty may mitigate some of these risks, but the overall competitive landscape and challenges in the streaming industry could weigh on investor sentiment.
Model: meta-llama/llama-4-scout, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.55, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.45, Reasoning: The news article discusses the profitability of streaming services, highlighting Netflix's leadership and the challenges faced by other media companies in achieving sustainable profits. While Netflix's performance is a positive indicator for the industry, the article also mentions concerns about the sustainability of this momentum, increased competition, and potential limits to subscriber growth and price increases. Apple Inc. (AAPL) is not directly mentioned in the article, but as a company with its own streaming service, Apple TV+, it could be indirectly affected by the industry trends. However, given that the news is more directly relevant to Netflix and other media companies, and without specific information about Apple's performance in streaming, the impact on AAPL's stock price is likely to be neutral or mildly positive due to the overall positive trend in the industry.
Model: meta-llama/llama-3.3-70b-instruct, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.3, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.7, Reasoning: The news article discusses the profitability of streaming services, with a focus on the major players in the industry, including Netflix, Disney, and Apple's competitor companies. While the article highlights the challenges faced by these companies, it also notes the progress made in achieving profitability. However, the article's tone suggests that the streaming wars are far from over, and the companies' ability to maintain profitability is uncertain. As Apple is not directly mentioned in the article as a major player in the streaming wars, the impact on its stock price is likely to be indirect. Considering the overall market trends and the competitive landscape, I estimate that the probability of Apple's stock price rising due to this news is lower than the probability of it falling.
Model: qwen/qwen-turbo, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.6, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.4, Reasoning: The financial news highlights a positive trend in streaming profits for media giants, including Apple Inc. However, it also notes challenges related to subscriber churn and maintaining profitability. While Apple's involvement in streaming services is relatively newer compared to Netflix or Disney, the overall positive sentiment towards streaming profitability may influence investor confidence positively. Nevertheless, uncertainties around sustainability pose a risk.
Round: 1
Model: openai/gpt-4o-mini, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.55, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.45, Reasoning: The news highlights a notable improvement in the profitability of streaming services among major media companies, which may create a positive sentiment in the market, potentially benefiting Apple Inc. through its Apple TV+ service. However, the overall caution expressed by analysts regarding the sustainability of this profitability and the constant challenges of subscriber churn and increasing competition temper this optimism. Given that Apple is not at the forefront of this streaming discussion, and factoring in the mixed predictions from previous rounds, the probability of a slight rise in Apple’s stock price is estimated to be higher, but still cautious due to prevailing uncertainties.
Model: google/gemini-2.0-flash-001, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.58, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.42, Reasoning: The news focuses on the broader streaming landscape's profitability turnaround, which is generally positive for Apple TV+. However, the article also highlights concerns about sustainability, churn, and increased competition in the streaming market. Given Apple's diversified business model and strong balance sheet, the impact of streaming news is moderate. Considering the previous predictions, there seems to be a slight optimism trend but a mixed consensus that the stock will slightly increase in terms of probability. I slightly discount the rise in probability due to increasing competition.
Model: google/gemini-flash-1.5, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.52, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.48, Reasoning: The news focuses on the broader streaming industry's profitability, which is positive but doesn't directly impact Apple.  While Apple TV+ is a part of Apple's services business, it's a relatively small portion compared to other revenue streams. The overall positive sentiment in the streaming market *could* indirectly boost Apple's stock slightly, but the lack of direct mention and the existing uncertainties regarding the sustainability of streaming profits for other companies temper any significant positive impact.  The analysts' cautious outlook further supports this neutrality.  Considering the range of previous predictions and the indirect nature of the news, the probability of a price rise is only slightly higher than a price fall, with a considerable chance of no significant movement.
Model: deepseek/deepseek-chat-v3-0324, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.55, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.45, Reasoning: The news highlights a significant improvement in the profitability of streaming services, with major players like Netflix leading the charge. While Apple Inc. (AAPL) is not directly mentioned, its Apple TV+ service is part of the broader streaming landscape. The positive trend in streaming profitability could indirectly benefit Apple, given its strong ecosystem and brand loyalty. However, the article also raises concerns about sustainability, subscriber churn, and competitive pressures, which could temper investor enthusiasm. Considering the mixed signals and the fact that streaming is a relatively small part of Apple's overall business, the impact on AAPL's stock price is likely to be neutral to mildly positive. Previous predictions from other models also reflect this cautious optimism, with most leaning slightly towards a price rise but acknowledging the risks.
Model: meta-llama/llama-4-scout, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.52, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.48, Reasoning: The news headline discusses the profitability of streaming services in 2024, highlighting the success of major players like Netflix, Disney, and others. While Apple Inc. (AAPL) is not directly mentioned, the overall positive trend in the streaming industry could have a mildly positive impact on Apple's stock. Apple's streaming service, Apple TV+, is part of its services segment, which contributes to its revenue. However, the article also mentions challenges such as maintaining profitability, subscriber churn, and competitive pressures. Given that Apple's stock is influenced by its overall ecosystem and not solely by its streaming service, the impact of this news is likely to be moderate. Considering the cautious outlook on the sustainability of streaming profits and the competitive landscape, I estimate a slightly higher probability of the stock price rising than falling, but with significant uncertainty.
Model: meta-llama/llama-3.3-70b-instruct, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.52, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.48, Reasoning: The news article discusses the profitability of streaming services, with a focus on the major players in the industry. While Apple Inc. is not directly mentioned as a major player in the streaming wars, the overall positive trend in streaming profitability may influence investor confidence positively. However, uncertainties around sustainability and the competitive landscape pose a risk. Considering the indirect impact on Apple and the cautious outlook from analysts, I estimate a moderate probability of the stock price rising due to the positive industry trend, but also acknowledge a significant probability of the stock price falling due to the challenges and uncertainties highlighted in the article.
Model: qwen/qwen-turbo, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.5, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.5, Reasoning: The financial news highlights a positive trend in streaming profits for media giants, including Apple Inc., with particular emphasis on Netflix's significant earnings and subscriber growth. Although the news is primarily focused on Netflix and other major competitors, it indicates a broader trend of profitability in the streaming industry. This upward trend is likely to positively affect Apple, given its involvement in streaming through Apple TV+. However, the cautionary tone from analysts about sustained profitability and increased competition introduces some level of uncertainty. Overall, while the news is more directly relevant to other companies, its positive sentiment and the potential indirect benefits to Apple's streaming service are likely to result in a minor positive shift in investor sentiment.
Round: 2
Model: openai/gpt-4o-mini, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.54, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.46, Reasoning: The news indicates a significant improvement in profitability for major streaming companies, which can create positive sentiment toward the streaming sector as a whole. However, the cautious tone of analysts regarding the sustainability of this profitability, as well as challenges such as subscriber churn and increasing competition, temper that optimism. While Apple is not a direct participant in the streaming wars but has its own service, Apple TV+, the overall positive trend in the industry could offer a lift to investor sentiment toward Apple. Balancing the mixed forecasts from previous predictions and the broader trends, I estimate a slight probability for a rise in stock price, acknowledging significant uncertainty due to competitive pressures.
Model: google/gemini-2.0-flash-001, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.53, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.47, Reasoning: The news focuses on the profitability of streaming services, led by Netflix, and the challenges faced by traditional media companies in sustaining this profitability. While positive for the streaming industry overall, its indirect impact on Apple is limited. Apple TV+ is a part of Apple's services segment, but not a primary driver of its stock. The previous predictions show a slight trend toward optimism, but with a generally cautious outlook due to concerns about competition, churn, and the sustainability of profits. Considering the indirect nature of the news and the mixed opinions, I am leaning towards a neutral to slightly positive impact on Apple's stock. The rise probability is slightly higher than the fall probability.
Model: google/gemini-flash-1.5, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.53, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.47, Reasoning: The news is positive for the streaming industry as a whole, showing a collective profit for the first time.  Netflix's success is highlighted, but the article emphasizes the challenges of sustained profitability, churn, and competition.  Apple's involvement in streaming (Apple TV+) is indirect; the news doesn't directly address its performance, only the general streaming landscape. While a positive industry trend could slightly boost Apple's stock due to its services segment, the overall cautious outlook and lack of specific Apple news limit the potential impact.  The consensus from previous predictions leans towards a slightly higher probability of a rise, but the uncertainty is significant. Considering the indirect nature of the news and the inherent volatility of the stock market, a prediction closer to neutral is warranted, reflecting a balance between the mildly positive industry trend and the considerable uncertainties.
Model: deepseek/deepseek-chat-v3-0324, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.55, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.45, Reasoning: The news highlights a positive turnaround in streaming profitability for major media companies in 2024, which could indirectly benefit Apple Inc. (AAPL) through its Apple TV+ service. However, the article also emphasizes significant challenges, including maintaining profitability, subscriber churn, and competitive pressures. Given that Apple's streaming service is a relatively small part of its diversified business, the direct impact of this news on AAPL's stock price is likely to be limited. The overall sentiment is cautiously optimistic, but uncertainties around the sustainability of streaming profits temper enthusiasm. Considering the mixed predictions from previous rounds and the indirect relevance of the news to Apple, the probability of a stock price rise is slightly higher than a fall, but not significantly so.
Model: meta-llama/llama-4-scout, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.52, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.48, Reasoning: The news highlights a positive trend in the profitability of streaming services for major media companies, which could indirectly benefit Apple Inc. through its Apple TV+ service. However, the article also mentions significant challenges such as subscriber churn, competitive pressures, and the sustainability of profitability. Given Apple's diversified business model and the relatively small impact of its streaming service on overall revenue, the news is likely to have a moderate positive effect on its stock price. The cautious outlook from analysts regarding the future of streaming profitability and the competitive landscape introduces uncertainty, but the overall positive trend in the industry could lead to a slightly higher probability of Apple's stock price rising than falling.
Model: meta-llama/llama-3.3-70b-instruct, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.53, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.47, Reasoning: The news highlights a positive trend in the profitability of streaming services among major media companies, which could indirectly benefit Apple Inc. through its Apple TV+ service. However, the overall caution expressed by analysts regarding the sustainability of this profitability and the constant challenges of subscriber churn and increasing competition temper this optimism. Considering the mixed predictions from previous rounds and the indirect impact of the news on Apple, the probability of a slight rise in Apple’s stock price is estimated to be higher, but still cautious due to prevailing uncertainties.
Model: qwen/qwen-turbo, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.55, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.45, Reasoning: The financial news highlights a positive trend in streaming profitability for media giants, including Apple Inc. (AAPL). Apple's Apple TV+ service is part of the broader streaming market, and the collective improvements in the streaming sector suggest a generally positive environment for Apple's services. However, the news is primarily focused on competitors like Netflix, Disney, and others, and it includes cautions about sustaining profitability and facing increased competition. Given the diverse sources of revenue for Apple beyond its streaming service, the impact is more likely to be indirect but generally positive.
